options.name: Coupons
options.description: These have certain terms, such as a certain quantity has to be purchased or if the customer is past a certain age

options.name: Disability Discount
options.description: Offer to customers with a disability

options.name: Discount Card
options.description: Issuing cards that give certain customers or any customer a discount

options.name: Student Discount
options.description: Usually given to students, but may go to educators

options.name: Military Discount
options.description: Offered to members of the military and family members

options.name: Partial Payment Discount
options.description: When a seller needs cash flow, he may offer a partial discount

options.name: Cash Payment Discount
options.description: Some retailers give customers a lower price if they pay with cash. This saves the fee the retailer pays on credit cards

options.name: Prompt Payment Discount
options.description: The wholesaler or manufacturer gives a discount to the retailer at the list price or catalogue price. This sometimes applies to promotions

options.name: Cash Back
options.description: A refund mailed to the purchaser after a purchase

options.name: Sliding Scale
options.description: This discount is calculated on a person's ability to pay. This is common with non-profit organizations

options.name: Seasonal Discount
options.description: Usually this is given during a slack period when sales are down

options.name: Kid Discount
options.description: This covers free or discounted prices for children under a certain age. There is usually a requirement that an adult pay full price

options.name: Trade Discount
options.description: Payments for functions such as shelf stocking, warehousing or shipping

options.name: Trade-in Credit
options.description: A discount for something that is returned
